search_information.query_displayed: Access to "Elite" Education in the Ivory Coast--The Importance of Socioeconomic Origins Charlick, Robert B. Sociology of Education

organic_results.title: Access to" Elite" Education in the Ivory Coast--The Importance of Socio-Economic Origins
organic_results.snippet: Scholars, agreeing that education is a vital resource for entry into the" elite" in contemporary Africa and that access to education is unequally distributed, continue to debate how open access to" elite" education actually is. This study's new data for the post-secondary level shed light both on the absolute representation of socio-economic groups in higher education and on the trends which have emerged since Clignet and Foster's report. The added evidence supports the view that the allocation of educational resources is still relatively open …

publication_info.summary: RB Charlick - Sociology of Education, 1978 - JSTOR
